channel.title: A very simple question needed to be asked
channel.description:
what is wrong with this? [URL=http://imageshack.us][IMG]http://img201.imageshack.us/img201/7078/scr3275d2dal2.png[/img][/URL]
and why am i getting this message? [URL=http://imageshack.us][IMG]http://img176.imageshack.us/img176/9439/scr328d2d8st9.jpg[/img][/URL]
Idk I'm completely clueless, and when i cancle all that stuff out this is what my original looks like
[URL=http://imageshack.us][IMG]http://img175.imageshack.us/img175/8097/scr32a5dc9xk4.jpg[/img][/URL]
my default gateway is 192.168.1.1 i know that for a fact, but it still suggest that it isn't...even when thats how i got onto my router in the first place.

item.title: A very simple question needed to be asked
item.dc:creator: @veki94 veki94
item.description:
@veki94 wrote:

No,I think you typed in your default getaway(192.168.0.1),and your computer’s IP.If you want to know your computer’s IP, open a command prompt then type in ipconfig , hit enter , and it will show up your internal adress or idk what is it’s name.
~veki~

Read full topic

item.title: A very simple question needed to be asked
item.dc:creator: @k_t0_the_0 k t0 the 0
item.description:
@k_t0_the_0 wrote:

ok, when i type in all the information and click save, it just resets itself, thats when i dont add a 1 to the end of the ip originally it says 192.168.1.0 but my ip is 192.168.1.1, i hit save with the 192.168.1.0 it doenst do anything except erase my work, and when i do 192.168.1.1 it just says there overlapping

Read full topic

item.title: A very simple question needed to be asked
item.dc:creator: @gamerx.info gamerx.info
item.description:
@gamerx.info wrote:

i could give you a CLEAN, and STRAIGHT answer. but you have to explain your problem in WORDS and not in pictures and broken works please re explain your problem and id be happy to help also please check portfoward.com its lots of info there and it quite good even i use it sometimes

Read full topic

item.description:
@k_t0_the_0 wrote:

sorry for waisting your time but thats why i put in pictures to explain the problem…[br][br][size=1]Posted on: December 29, 2007, 02:14:10 AM[/size][hr]I’m really starting to flip out, i’ve waisted almost 2 hours trying to figure this out and NOTHING works, and all the help is completely keeping me off task. Can’t someone give me a CLEAN, and STRAIGHT answer. PLEASE.

item.description:
@gamerx.info wrote:

by the looks of your pictures it looked as if you were forwarding the ports to your router whitch would explain it sais port overlap occoured because its over lapping with itselF!!! but next time explain properly what you need and save us ppl that r here to help the time of whriting something that big ok???

item.title: A very simple question needed to be asked
item.dc:creator: @k_t0_the_0 k t0 the 0
item.description:
@k_t0_the_0 wrote:

thats not it BUD, thanks for the tip but i already know what my router is its a Linksys WRTG5 and the ip is 192.168.1.1, yea got it lol…i wanna know why its not working…

Read full topic
item.source: A very simple question needed to be asked

item.title: A very simple question needed to be asked
item.dc:creator: @gamerx.info gamerx.info
item.description:
@gamerx.info wrote:

ok it looks as if you are forwarding your port to 192.168.1.1 that is your routers ip addres(internal) so what you need to do if forward the port to YOUR computers ip address you can find this by going into cmd(command prompt) by going start_run then type cmd and press enter (may be different on vista but then you type ipconfig andpress enter then at IP Address: it will have your ip address type that in the routers form and its a goa BUT this is if you allready have a static ip address for your computer that is too much to explain here so visit http://www.portforward.com/default.htm and click portforwarding and it will have alll you need to know there
ps: sorry about all the broken words i tend to type fasly lol <- fastly
thanks and hope this helps
GAMERX

(edit):website changed

Read full topic
